title: Understanding the LIKE Operator
text: The LIKE operator is used in a WHERE clause to search for a specified pattern in a column.

title: Using Wildcards with LIKE
text: Wildcards are special characters used with the LIKE operator to search for a pattern. The percentage sign (%) represents zero, one, or multiple characters.

title: Pattern Matching with %
text: To find any record containing the word 'priority' anywhere in the Comment column, use the pattern '%priority%'. This pattern allows for any characters before and after 'priority'.

title: Constructing the WHERE Clause
text: Use the LIKE operator with the correct pattern to match any record containing 'priority'.
